title: What community has the best French and Indian war renactments? - Quora
tags: The French and Indian War (Known commonly as the 7 Year's War)

response.answer_text: It’s an odd name for a war that was almost a world war. The term is only used in the USA and has a very narrow perspective. Most of the English speaking world refers to it as the Seven Years’ War. Not exactly the catchiest of names but right up there with the famous War of 1812. The historians must have spend at least one sleepless night thinking that one up. The war did indeed involve the French and it did involve “Indians” as in the US usage but also Indians as in people from India since the war was fought on the high seas, in Europe, In North America including the very valuable Caribbean colonies and in India as I said. Anywhere where French and British interests clashed. Since one of the major battles took place in present Canada Canadians should have a determining vote as to the name of the war, don’t you think. I am assuming you know which battle I am speaking of. It is one of the key battles in North American History.

There are lots of good reenactments in the Great Lakes Region and the US Midwest, as well as some in upstate New York-Canadian border region. French and Indian War Encampment or French and Indian War (7 Years War) or The Seven Year War Website
